byline.contributor: Richard Pérez-Peña reported from New York, Frances Robles from Orlando, and Eric Lichtblau from Washington. Alan Blinder contributed reporting from Port St. Lucie, Fla.
byline.original: By RICHARD PÉREZ-PEÑA, FRANCES ROBLES and ERIC LICHTBLAU

abstract: Orlando, Fla, Police Chief John Mina says in press conference police are investigating possibility that some of 49 killed and 53 wounded in nightclub massacre were struck by bullets fired by police when they stormed bathroom in which shooter had taken hostages; defends way police handled mass shooting and hostage situation.
lead_paragraph: As partial transcripts of phone calls by the killer, Omar Mateen, were released, officials withstood lingering questions about the timing of the assault against him and whether police gunfire hit any victims.

headline.main: Orlando Police Defend Actions as Clock Ticked in Massacre
headline.print_headline: Police Defend Actions as Clock Ticked in Florida

snippet: As partial transcripts of phone calls by the killer, Omar Mateen, were released, officials withstood lingering questions about the timing of the assault against him and whether police gunfire hit any victims.
